intro: Eriocoelum oblongum, commonly known as the narrowleaf eriocoelum, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal or inland regions. Eriocoelum oblongum is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
